(defaults to null with no animation)

props.name: autoCreate

props.name: autoScroll

props.name: autoTabs
props.desc: If true, all elements with class 'x-dlg-tab' will get automatically converted to tabs (defaults to false)

props.desc: False to disable dragging of the dialog within the viewport (defaults to true)

props.name: fixedcenter
props.desc: True to ensure that anytime the dialog is shown or resized it gets centered (defaults to false)

props.desc: Height of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

props.name: minButtonWidth

props.name: minWidth

props.name: modal
props.desc: True to show the dialog modally, preventing user interaction with the rest of the page (defaults to false)

props.name: proxyDrag

draggable = true (defaults to false)

props.name: resizable
props.desc: False to disable manual dialog resizing (defaults to true)

props.name: resizeHandles
props.desc:
Which resize handles to display - see the {@link Roo.Resizable} handles config
property for valid values (defaults to 'all')

props.name: shadow
props.desc:
True or "sides" for the default effect, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop" for bottom-right
shadow (defaults to false)

props.name: shadowOffset
props.desc: The number of pixels to offset the shadow if displayed (defaults to 5)

props.name: shim
props.desc: True to create an iframe shim that prevents selects from showing through (defaults to false)

props.name: syncHeightBeforeShow
props.desc: True to cause the dimensions to be recalculated before the dialog is shown (defaults to false)

props.name: tabTag
props.desc: The tag name of tab elements, used when autoTabs = true (defaults to 'div')

props.name: title
props.desc: Default text to display in the title bar (defaults to null)

props.name: width
props.desc: Width of the dialog in pixels (can also be set via CSS).  Determined by browser if unspecified.

props.name: x
props.desc: The default left page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

props.name: y
props.desc: The default top page coordinate of the dialog (defaults to center screen)

props.desc: A function called when the button is clicked (can be used instead of click event)

props.name: hidden
props.desc: True to start hidden (defaults to false)

props.name: icon
props.desc:
The path to an image to display in the button (the image will be set as the background-image
CSS property of the button by default, so if you want a mixed icon/text button, set cls:"x-btn-text-icon")

props.name: iconCls
props.desc: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon for this button (defaults to undefined).

props.name: menu
props.desc: Standard menu attribute consisting of a reference to a menu object, a menu id or a menu config blob (defaults to undefined).

props.name: menuAlign
props.desc: The position to align the menu to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details, defaults to 'tl-bl?').

props.desc: The minimum width for this button (used to give a set of buttons a common width)

props.name: pressed
props.desc: True to start pressed (only if enableToggle = true)

props.name: renderTo
props.desc: The element to append the button to

props.name: repeat
props.desc:
True to repeat fire the click event while the mouse is down. This can also be

props.name: scope

props.name: tabIndex

props.desc:

An {@link Roo.Template} with which to create the Button's main element. This Template must
contain numeric substitution parameter 0 if it is to display the tRoo property. Changing the template could
require code modifications if required elements (e.g. a button) aren't present.

props.name: text

props.name: toggleGroup
props.desc:
The group this toggle button is a member of (only 1 per group can be pressed, only
   applies if enableToggle = true)

props.desc: The tooltip for the button - can be a string or QuickTips config object

props.name: tooltipType
props.desc: The type of tooltip to use. Either "qtip" (default) for QuickTips or "title" for title attribute.

props.name: type
props.desc: The button's type, corresponding to the DOM input element type attribute.  Either "submit," "reset" or "button" (default).

events.name: mouseout
events.desc: Fires when the mouse exits the button

events.name: mouseover
events.desc: Fires when the mouse hovers over the button

events.name: render
events.desc: Fires when the button is rendered

events.name: toggle
events.desc: Fires when the "pressed" state of this button changes (only if enableToggle = true)

props.name: allowReselect

props.name: itemCls

props.desc:

the hex codes are case-sensitive.

events.name: select
events.desc: Fires when a color is selected

props.name: actionMode
props.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

props.name: allowDomMove
props.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

props.name: disableClass
props.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

props.name: hideMode
props.desc:
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.

events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.name: beforerender
events.desc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false to stop the render.

events.name: beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.desc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.desc: Fires after the component is disabled.

events.desc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.desc: Fires after the component is hidden.

events.desc: Fires after the component is rendered.

events.name: show
events.desc: Fires after the component is shown.

props.desc: True to auto generate the DOM element for this panel, or a {@link Roo.DomHelper} config of the element to create

props.name: autoScroll

props.name: params

events.name: deactivate
events.desc: Fires when this panel is activated.

events.desc: Fires when this panel is resized if fitToFrame is true.

props.name: allowCopy
props.desc: Causes ctrl/drag operations to copy nodes rather than move.

props.name: copy
props.desc: Causes drag operations to copy nodes rather than move.

props.name: dragGroup
props.desc: The ddgroup name(s) for the View's DragZone.

props.name: dropGroup
props.desc: The ddgroup name(s) for the View's DropZone.

props.desc: An array of textual day names which can be overriden for localization support (defaults to Date.dayNames)

props.desc: The tooltip text to display when the date falls on a disabled date (defaults to "")

props.desc: An array of days to disable, 0-based. For example, [0, 6] disables Sunday and Saturday (defaults to null).

props.desc: The tooltip to display when the date falls on a disabled day (defaults to "")

The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support.  The format must be
valid according to {@link Date#parseDate} (defaults to 'm/d/y').

props.desc: Maximum allowable date (JavaScript date object, defaults to null)

props.desc: The error text to display if the maxDate validation fails (defaults to "This date is after the maximum date")

props.name: minDate
props.desc: Minimum allowable date (JavaScript date object, defaults to null)

props.desc: The error text to display if the minDate validation fails (defaults to "This date is before the minimum date")

props.desc: The text to display on the ok button

props.desc: The previous month navigation button tooltip (defaults to 'Previous Month (Control+Left)')

props.desc: Show a clear button (usefull for date form elements that can be blank.)

props.name: startDay
props.desc: Day index at which the week should begin, 0-based (defaults to 0, which is Sunday)

props.name: todayText
props.desc: The text to display on the button that selects the current date (defaults to "Today")

props.desc: The position to align to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details, defaults to "c-c?").

props.name: autosize
props.desc:
True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field, "width" to adopt the width only,
or "height" to adopt the height only (defaults to false)

props.name: cancelOnEsc
props.desc: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed (defaults to false)

props.name: completeOnEnter
props.desc: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed (defaults to false)

props.name: constrain
props.desc: True to constrain the editor to the viewport

props.name: hideEl
props.desc: False to keep the bound element visible while the editor is displayed (defaults to true)

props.name: ignoreNoChange
props.desc:
True to skip the the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and
the value has not changed (defaults to false).  Applies only to string values - edits for other data types
will never be ignored.

props.name: revertInvalid
props.desc:
True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field
validation fails (defaults to true)

props.name: shadow
props.desc:
"sides" for sides/bottom only, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop"
for bottom-right shadow (defaults to "frame")

props.name: updateEl
props.desc: True to update the innerHTML of the bound element when the update completes (defaults to false)

props.name: value
props.desc: The data value of the underlying field (defaults to "")

events.desc:
Fires after a change has been made to the field, but before the change is reflected in the underlying
field.  Saving the change to the field can be canceled by returning false from the handler of this event.
Note that if the value has not changed and ignoreNoChange = true, the editing will still end but this
event will not fire since no edit actually occurred.

events.name: beforestartedit
events.desc:
Fires when editing is initiated, but before the value changes.  Editing can be canceled by returning
false from the handler of this event.

events.name: complete
events.desc: Fires after editing is complete and any changed value has been written to the underlying field.

events.name: specialkey
events.desc:
Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed.  You can check
{@link Roo.EventObject#getKey} to determine which key was pressed.

events.name: startedit
events.desc: Fires when this editor is displayed

a function which returns such a specification that will be applied to the Element after the effect finishes

props.desc: Whether the effect should block other effects from queueing while it runs

props.name: callback

props.name: callbackParam
props.desc:
(Optional) The name of the parameter to pass to the server which tells the server the name of the callback function set up by the load call to process the returned data object. Defaults to "callback".

The server-side processing must read this parameter value, and generate javascript output which calls this named function passing the data object as its only parameter.

props.name: nocache

(Optional) Defaults to true. Disable cacheing by adding a unique parameter
name to the request.

If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the

props.desc:
The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the start of typing and sending the
query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local')

props.desc:
Multiple date formats separated by "|" to try when parsing a user input value and it doesn't match the defined
format (defaults to 'm/d/Y|m-d-y|m-d-Y|m/d|m-d|d').

props.name: autoCreate
props.desc:
A DomHelper element spec, or true for a default element spec (defaults to
{tag: "input", type: "text", size: "10", autocomplete: "off"})

props.name: disabledDates
props.desc:
An array of "dates" to disable, as strings. These strings will be used to build a dynamic regular expression so they are very powerful. Some examples:
  • ["03/08/2003", "09/16/2003"] would disable those exact dates
  • ["03/08", "09/16"] would disable those days for every year
  • ["^03/08"] would only match the beginning (useful if you are using short years)
  • ["03/../2006"] would disable every day in March 2006
  • ["^03"] would disable every day in every March
In order to support regular expressions, if you are using a date format that has "." in it, you will have to escape the dot when restricting dates. For example: ["03\\.08\\.03"].

props.name: disabledDatesText
props.desc: The tooltip text to display when the date falls on a disabled date (defaults to 'Disabled')

props.name: disabledDays
props.desc: An array of days to disable, 0 based. For example, [0, 6] disables Sunday and Saturday (defaults to null).

props.name: disabledDaysText
props.desc: The tooltip to display when the date falls on a disabled day (defaults to 'Disabled')

props.name: format
props.desc:
The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support.  The format must be
valid according to {@link Date#parseDate} (defaults to 'm/d/y').

props.name: invalidText
props.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the field is invalid (defaults to
'{value} is not a valid date - it must be in the format {format}').

props.name: maxText
props.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the cell is after maxValue (defaults to
'The date in this field must be before {maxValue}').

props.name: maxValue
props.desc:
The maximum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a
valid format (defaults to null).

props.name: minText
props.desc:
The error text to display when the date in the cell is before minValue (defaults to
'The date in this field must be after {minValue}').

props.name: minValue
props.desc:
The minimum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a
valid format (defaults to null).

props.name: triggerClass
props.desc: An additional CSS class used to style the trigger button. The trigger will always get the class 'x-form-trigger' and triggerClass will be appended if specified (defaults to 'x-form-date-trigger' which displays a calendar icon).

if enabled, then the date field will use a hidden field to store the

props.desc:
A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null).
If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value.  If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using {@link #regexText}.

A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null).
If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the
current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

events.name: afteredit
events.desc:
Fires after a cell is edited.
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value being set
  • originalValue - The original value for the field, before the edit.
  • row - The grid row index
  • column - The grid column index

events.name: beforeedit
events.desc:
Fires before cell editing is triggered. The edit event object has the following properties
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value for the field being edited.
  • row - The grid row index
  • column - The grid column index
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the edit or return false from your handler.

events.name: validateedit
events.desc:
Fires after a cell is edited, but before the value is set in the record. You can use this to modify the value being set in the field, Return false to cancel the change. The edit event object has the following properties
  • editor - This editor
  • grid - This grid
  • record - The record being edited
  • field - The field name being edited
  • value - The value being set
  • originalValue - The original value for the field, before the edit.
  • row - The grid row index
  • column - The grid column index
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the edit or return false from your handler.

props.name: autoExpandColumn

props.desc: True to automatically resize the columns to fit their content on initial render. It is more efficient to explicitly size the columns through the ColumnModel's {@link Roo.grid.ColumnModel#width} config option. Default is false.

props.desc: True to autoSize the grid when the window resizes. Default is true.

props.name: enableDrop
props.desc: true to enable just drop

props.name: hlColor
props.desc: The color of the node highlight (defaults to C3DAF9)

props.name: hlDrop
props.desc: false to disable node highlight on drop (defaults to the value of Roo.enableFx)

props.name: lines
props.desc: false to disable tree lines (defaults to true)

props.name: loader
props.desc: A TreeLoader for use with this TreePanel

props.name: pathSeparator
props.desc: The token used to separate sub-paths in path strings (defaults to '/')

props.name: renderer
props.desc:
Sets the rendering (formatting) function for the nodes. to return HTML markup for the tree view. The render function is called with the following parameters:
  • The {Object} The data for the node.

props.name: rendererTip
props.desc:
Sets the rendering (formatting) function for the nodes hovertip to return HTML markup for the tree view. The render function is called with the following parameters:
  • The {Object} The data for the node.

props.name: rootVisible
props.desc: false to hide the root node (defaults to true)

props.name: selModel
props.desc: A tree selection model to use with this TreePanel (defaults to a {@link Roo.tree.DefaultSelectionModel})

props.name: singleExpand
props.desc: true if only 1 node per branch may be expanded

events.name: beforechildrenrendered
events.desc: Fires right before the child nodes for a node are rendered

events.name: beforeclick
events.desc: Fires before click processing on a node. Return false to cancel the default action.

events.name: beforecollapse
events.desc: Fires before a node is collapsed, return false to cancel.

events.name: beforeexpand
events.desc: Fires before a node is expanded, return false to cancel.

events.name: beforeload
events.desc: Fires before a node is loaded, return false to cancel

events.name: beforenodedrop
events.desc:
Fires when a DD object is dropped on a node in this tree for preprocessing. Return false to cancel the drop. The dropEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Drop node(s) provided by the source OR you can supply node(s) to be inserted by setting them on this object.
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the drop.

events.name: checkchange
events.desc: Fires when a node with a checkbox's checked property changes

events.name: click
events.desc: Fires when a node is clicked

events.name: collapse
events.desc: Fires when a node is collapsed

events.name: contextmenu
events.desc: Fires when a node is right clicked

events.name: dblclick
events.desc: Fires when a node is double clicked

events.name: disabledchange
events.desc: Fires when the disabled status of a node changes

events.name: dragdrop
events.desc: Fires when a dragged node is dropped on a valid DD target

events.name: enddrag
events.desc: Fires when a drag operation is complete

events.name: expand
events.desc: Fires when a node is expanded

events.name: load
events.desc: Fires when a node is loaded

events.name: nodedragover
events.desc:
Fires when a tree node is being targeted for a drag drop, return false to signal drop not allowed. The dragOverEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Drop node(s) provided by the source.
  • cancel - Set this to true to signal drop not allowed.

events.name: nodedrop
events.desc:
Fires after a DD object is dropped on a node in this tree. The dropEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Dropped node(s).

events.name: startdrag
events.desc: Fires when a node starts being dragged

events.name: textchange
events.desc: Fires when the text for a node is changed

props.name: caseSensitive
props.desc: true for case sensitive sort (defaults to false)

props.name: dir
props.desc: The direction to sort (asc or desc) (defaults to asc)

props.name: folderSort
props.desc: True to sort leaf nodes under non leaf nodes

props.name: leafAttr
props.desc: The attribute used to determine leaf nodes in folder sort (defaults to "leaf")

props.name: property
props.desc: The named attribute on the node to sort by (defaults to text)

props.name: sortType
props.desc: A custom "casting" function used to convert node values before sorting

props.name: accelerate
props.desc:
True if autorepeating should start slowly and accelerate.
          "interval" and "delay" are ignored. "immediate" is honored.

props.name: delay
props.desc:
The initial delay before the repeating event begins firing.
Similar to an autorepeat key delay.

props.name: el
props.desc: The element to act as a button.

props.name: interval
props.desc: The interval between firings of the "click" event. Default 10 ms.

props.name: pressClass
props.desc: A CSS class name to be applied to the element while pressed.

props.name: preventDefault
props.desc: True to prevent the default click event

props.name: stopDefault
props.desc: True to stop the default click event

events.name: click
events.desc: Fires on a specified interval during the time the element is pressed.

events.name: mousedown
events.desc: Fires when the mouse button is depressed.

events.name: mouseup
events.desc: Fires when the mouse key is released.

events.name: add
events.desc: Fires when an item is added to the collection.

events.name: clear
events.desc: Fires when the collection is cleared.

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when an item is removed from the collection.

events.name: replace
events.desc: Fires when an item is replaced in the collection.

props.name: listeners
disabled
props.desc: If this module is disabled by some rule, return true from the funtion

props.name: items
props.desc:
A single item array - the first element is the root of the tree..
It's done this way to stay compatible with the Xtype system...

props.name: name
props.desc: String to display while loading.

props.name: order
props.desc: Used to set the order in which elements are created (usefull for multiple tabs)

props.name: parent
props.desc: Name of parent element which it get xtype added to..
